attributes.action: tell the London Olympic Committee to scrap the new London 2012 Olympic's logo
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
I'm pleased that London has been given the chance to stage the Olympic Games in 2012. I am hoping that London will be able to show what a great city it is. I love living here and am proud of what it has to offer.

As Tony said:
When people see the new brand, we want them to be inspired to make a positive change in their life!

The new London 2012 Olympic Logo does the exact opposite, it does not inspire, it is dull, cheap looking and says nothing positive about London. It is a pathetic attempt at creating a "brand" which looks like a Blue Peter 2minute children’s task. London is a city of innovation and perhaps the only good thing that has come out creating a horrid looking logo is that the most of England have put forward their ideas. Obviously shows they care, not that they needed to show it... although it’s great to see once in a while!

Tony, do the admiral thing and tell the London Olympic Committee to scrap this logo.

rejection.details:
This petition overlaps with several already in existence –
http://petitions.pm.gov.uk/2012-Emblem/
reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
